third_party/closure/goog/svgpan/svgpan.js

1/**
2 * SVGPan library 1.2.2
3 * ======================
4 *
5 * Given an unique existing element with a given id (or by default, the first
6 * g-element), including the library into any SVG adds the following
7 * capabilities:
8 *
9 * - Mouse panning
10 * - Mouse zooming (using the wheel)
11 * - Object dragging
12 *
13 * You can configure the behaviour of the pan/zoom/drag via setOptions().
14 *
15 * Known issues:
16 *
17 * - Zooming (while panning) on Safari has still some issues
18 *
19 * Releases:
20 *
21 * 1.2.2, Tue Aug 30 17:21:56 CEST 2011, Andrea Leofreddi
22 * - Fixed viewBox on root tag (#7)
23 * - Improved zoom speed (#2)
24 *
25 * 1.2.1, Mon Jul 4 00:33:18 CEST 2011, Andrea Leofreddi
26 * - Fixed a regression with mouse wheel (now working on Firefox 5)
27 * - Working with viewBox attribute (#4)
28 * - Added "use strict;" and fixed resulting warnings (#5)
29 * - Added configuration variables, dragging is disabled by default (#3)
30 *
31 * 1.2, Sat Mar 20 08:42:50 GMT 2010, Zeng Xiaohui
32 * Fixed a bug with browser mouse handler interaction
33 *
34 * 1.1, Wed Feb 3 17:39:33 GMT 2010, Zeng Xiaohui
35 * Updated the zoom code to support the mouse wheel on Safari/Chrome
36 *
37 * 1.0, Andrea Leofreddi
38 * First release
39 */
40

74goog.provide('svgpan.SvgPan');
75
76goog.require('goog.Disposable');
77goog.require('goog.events');
78goog.require('goog.events.EventType');
79goog.require('goog.events.MouseWheelHandler');
80
81
82
83/**
84 * Instantiates an SvgPan object.
85 * @param {string=} opt_graphElementId The id of the graph element.
86 * @param {Element=} opt_root An optional document root.
87 * @constructor
88 * @extends {goog.Disposable}
89 */
90svgpan.SvgPan = function(opt_graphElementId, opt_root) {
91 svgpan.SvgPan.base(this, 'constructor');
92
93 /** @private {Element} */
94 this.root_ = opt_root || document.documentElement;
95
96 /** @private {?string} */
97 this.graphElementId_ = opt_graphElementId || null;
98
99 /** @private {boolean} */
100 this.cancelNextClick_ = false;
101
102 /** @private {boolean} */
103 this.enablePan_ = true;
104
105 /** @private {boolean} */
106 this.enableZoom_ = true;
107
108 /** @private {boolean} */
109 this.enableDrag_ = false;
110
111 /** @private {number} */
112 this.zoomScale_ = 0.4;
113
114 /** @private {svgpan.SvgPan.State} */
115 this.state_ = svgpan.SvgPan.State.NONE;
116
117 /** @private {Element} */
118 this.svgRoot_ = null;
119
120 /** @private {Element} */
121 this.stateTarget_ = null;
122
123 /** @private {SVGPoint} */
124 this.stateOrigin_ = null;
125
126 /** @private {SVGMatrix} */
127 this.stateTf_ = null;
128
129 /** @private {goog.events.MouseWheelHandler} */
130 this.mouseWheelHandler_ = null;
131
132 this.setupHandlers_();
133};
134goog.inherits(svgpan.SvgPan, goog.Disposable);
135
136
137/** @override */
138svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.disposeInternal = function() {
139 svgpan.SvgPan.base(this, 'disposeInternal');
140 goog.events.removeAll(this.root_);
141 this.mouseWheelHandler_.dispose();
142};
143
144
145/**
146 * @enum {string}
147 */
148svgpan.SvgPan.State = {
149 NONE: 'none',
150 PAN: 'pan',
151 DRAG: 'drag'
152};
153
154
155/**
156 * Enables/disables panning the entire SVG (default = true).
157 * @param {boolean} enabled Whether or not to allow panning.
158 */
159svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.setPanEnabled = function(enabled) {
160 this.enablePan_ = enabled;
161};
162
163
164/**
165 * Enables/disables zooming (default = true).
166 * @param {boolean} enabled Whether or not to allow zooming (default = true).
167 */
168svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.setZoomEnabled = function(enabled) {
169 this.enableZoom_ = enabled;
170};
171
172
173/**
174 * Enables/disables dragging individual SVG objects (default = false).
175 * @param {boolean} enabled Whether or not to allow dragging of objects.
176 */
177svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.setDragEnabled = function(enabled) {
178 this.enableDrag_ = enabled;
179};
180
181
182/**
183 * Sets the sensitivity of mousewheel zooming (default = 0.4).
184 * @param {number} scale The new zoom scale.
185 */
186svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.setZoomScale = function(scale) {
187 this.zoomScale_ = scale;
188};
189
190
191/**
192 * Registers mouse event handlers.
193 * @private
194 */
195svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.setupHandlers_ = function() {
196 goog.events.listen(this.root_, goog.events.EventType.CLICK,
197 goog.bind(this.handleMouseClick_, this));
198 goog.events.listen(this.root_, goog.events.EventType.MOUSEUP,
199 goog.bind(this.handleMouseUp_, this));
200 goog.events.listen(this.root_, goog.events.EventType.MOUSEDOWN,
201 goog.bind(this.handleMouseDown_, this));
202 goog.events.listen(this.root_, goog.events.EventType.MOUSEMOVE,
203 goog.bind(this.handleMouseMove_, this));
204 this.mouseWheelHandler_ = new goog.events.MouseWheelHandler(this.root_);
205 goog.events.listen(this.mouseWheelHandler_,
206 goog.events.MouseWheelHandler.EventType.MOUSEWHEEL,
207 goog.bind(this.handleMouseWheel_, this));
208};
209
210
211/**
212 * Retrieves the root element for SVG manipulation. The element is then cached.
213 * @param {Document} svgDoc The document.
214 * @return {Element} The svg root.
215 * @private
216 */
217svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.getRoot_ = function(svgDoc) {
218 if (!this.svgRoot_) {
219 var r = this.graphElementId_ ?
220 svgDoc.getElementById(this.graphElementId_) : svgDoc.documentElement;
221 var t = r;
222 while (t != svgDoc) {
223 if (t.getAttribute('viewBox')) {
224 this.setCtm_(r, r.getCTM());
225 t.removeAttribute('viewBox');
226 }
227 t = t.parentNode;
228 }
229 this.svgRoot_ = r;
230 }
231 return this.svgRoot_;
232};
233
234
235/**
236 * Instantiates an SVGPoint object with given event coordinates.
237 * @param {!goog.events.Event} evt The event with coordinates.
238 * @return {SVGPoint} The created point.
239 * @private
240 */
241svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.getEventPoint_ = function(evt) {
242 return this.newPoint_(evt.clientX, evt.clientY);
243};
244
245
246/**
247 * Instantiates an SVGPoint object with given coordinates.
248 * @param {number} x The x coordinate.
249 * @param {number} y The y coordinate.
250 * @return {SVGPoint} The created point.
251 * @private
252 */
253svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.newPoint_ = function(x, y) {
254 var p = this.root_.createSVGPoint();
255 p.x = x;
256 p.y = y;
257 return p;
258};
259
260
261/**
262 * Sets the current transform matrix of an element.
263 * @param {Element} element The element.
264 * @param {SVGMatrix} matrix The transform matrix.
265 * @private
266 */
267svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.setCtm_ = function(element, matrix) {
268 var s = 'matrix(' + matrix.a + ',' + matrix.b + ',' + matrix.c + ',' +
269 matrix.d + ',' + matrix.e + ',' + matrix.f + ')';
270 element.setAttribute('transform', s);
271};
272
273
274/**
275 * Handle mouse wheel event.
276 * @param {!goog.events.Event} evt The event.
277 * @private
278 */
279svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.handleMouseWheel_ = function(evt) {
280 if (!this.enableZoom_)
281 return;
282
283 // Prevents scrolling.
284 evt.preventDefault();
285
286 var svgDoc = evt.target.ownerDocument;
287
288 var delta = evt.deltaY / -9;
289 var z = Math.pow(1 + this.zoomScale_, delta);
290 var g = this.getRoot_(svgDoc);
291 var p = this.getEventPoint_(evt);
292 p = p.matrixTransform(g.getCTM().inverse());
293
294 // Compute new scale matrix in current mouse position
295 var k = this.root_.createSVGMatrix().translate(
296 p.x, p.y).scale(z).translate(-p.x, -p.y);
297 this.setCtm_(g, g.getCTM().multiply(k));
298
299 if (typeof(this.stateTf_) == 'undefined') {
300 this.stateTf_ = g.getCTM().inverse();
301 }
302 this.stateTf_ =
303 this.stateTf_ ? this.stateTf_.multiply(k.inverse()) : this.stateTf_;
304};
305
306
307/**
308 * Handle mouse move event.
309 * @param {!goog.events.Event} evt The event.
310 * @private
311 */
312svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.handleMouseMove_ = function(evt) {
313 if (evt.button != 0) {
314 return;
315 }
316 this.handleMove(evt.clientX, evt.clientY, evt.target.ownerDocument);
317};
318
319
320/**
321 * Handles mouse motion for the given coordinates.
322 * @param {number} x The x coordinate.
323 * @param {number} y The y coordinate.
324 * @param {Document} svgDoc The svg document.
325 */
326svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.handleMove = function(x, y, svgDoc) {
327 var g = this.getRoot_(svgDoc);
328 if (this.state_ == svgpan.SvgPan.State.PAN && this.enablePan_) {
329 // Pan mode
330 var p = this.newPoint_(x, y).matrixTransform(
331 /** @type {!SVGMatrix} */ (this.stateTf_));
332 this.setCtm_(g, this.stateTf_.inverse().translate(
333 p.x - this.stateOrigin_.x, p.y - this.stateOrigin_.y));
334 this.cancelNextClick_ = true;
335 } else if (this.state_ == svgpan.SvgPan.State.DRAG && this.enableDrag_) {
336 // Drag mode
337 var p = this.newPoint_(x, y).matrixTransform(g.getCTM().inverse());
338 this.setCtm_(this.stateTarget_, this.root_.createSVGMatrix().translate(
339 p.x - this.stateOrigin_.x, p.y - this.stateOrigin_.y).multiply(
340 g.getCTM().inverse()).multiply(this.stateTarget_.getCTM()));
341 this.stateOrigin_ = p;
342 }
343};
344
345
346/**
347 * Handle click event.
348 * @param {!goog.events.Event} evt The event.
349 * @private
350 */
351svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.handleMouseDown_ = function(evt) {
352 if (evt.button != 0) {
353 return;
354 }
355 // Prevent selection while dragging.
356 evt.preventDefault();
357 var svgDoc = evt.target.ownerDocument;
358
359 var g = this.getRoot_(svgDoc);
360
361 if (evt.target.tagName == 'svg' || !this.enableDrag_) {
362 // Pan mode
363 this.state_ = svgpan.SvgPan.State.PAN;
364 this.stateTf_ = g.getCTM().inverse();
365 this.stateOrigin_ = this.getEventPoint_(evt).matrixTransform(this.stateTf_);
366 } else {
367 // Drag mode
368 this.state_ = svgpan.SvgPan.State.DRAG;
369 this.stateTarget_ = /** @type {Element} */ (evt.target);
370 this.stateTf_ = g.getCTM().inverse();
371 this.stateOrigin_ = this.getEventPoint_(evt).matrixTransform(this.stateTf_);
372 }
373};
374
375
376/**
377 * Handle mouse button release event.
378 * @param {!goog.events.Event} evt The event.
379 * @private
380 */
381svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.handleMouseUp_ = function(evt) {
382 if (this.state_ != svgpan.SvgPan.State.NONE) {
383 this.endPanOrDrag();
384 }
385};
386
387
388/**
389 * Ends pan/drag mode.
390 */
391svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.endPanOrDrag = function() {
392 if (this.state_ != svgpan.SvgPan.State.NONE) {
393 this.state_ = svgpan.SvgPan.State.NONE;
394 }
395};
396
397
398/**
399 * Handle mouse clicks.
400 * @param {!goog.events.Event} evt The event.
401 * @private
402 */
403svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.handleMouseClick_ = function(evt) {
404 // We only set cancelNextClick_ after panning occurred, and use it to prevent
405 // the default action that would otherwise take place when clicking on the
406 // element (for instance, navigation on clickable links, but also any click
407 // handler that may be set on an SVG element, in the case of active SVG
408 // content)
409 if (this.cancelNextClick_) {
410 // Cancel potential click handler on active SVG content.
411 evt.stopPropagation();
412 // Cancel navigation when panning on clickable links.
413 evt.preventDefault();
414 }
415 this.cancelNextClick_ = false;
416};
417
418
419/**
420 * Returns the current state.
421 * @return {!svgpan.SvgPan.State}
422 */
423svgpan.SvgPan.prototype.getState = function() {
424 return this.state_;
425};
